newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BYULGARIA LEV ENDS FLAT AROUND 230 PER DOLLAR.
newsitem.headline: BYULGARIA LEV ENDS FLAT AROUND 230 PER DOLLAR.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed between 229.80-230.20 per dollar, unchanged from around 230 in the morning due to foreign currency sales by the central bank amid low demand on the local interbank market, dealers said.

"Foreign currency demand was not large and dollar sales by the central bank helped the lev consolidate between 229.60 and 230.30 levs per dollar with the spread narrowing to 229.80/230.20 at the close," a commercial bank dealer said.
Traders said that interest for dollar purchases was centred around 229.60/80 levs throughout the day but trade was thin at the beginning when dollars were offered around 231 levs.
The central bank then began offering dollars to the market through selected commercial banks and the rest of them lowered their dollar asks to 230.00/30 levs, dealers added.
Central bank officials were not availavle for comment.
The Bulgarian National Bank's foreign exchange reserves rose to $575 million at the end of August from $523 million a month before. -- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
